  • Constructor Details

    • Enemy

      public Enemy(float x, float y, float width, float height, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion texture, float speed, float radius, int damage, int health)
      Creates a new enemy with the specified stats and position.
      Parameters:
      x - starting x coordinate in world units
      y - starting y coordinate in world units
      width - width of the enemy sprite
      height - height of the enemy sprite
      texture - the image to display for this enemy
      speed - movement speed (different for each enemy type)
      radius - detection radius (how far the enemy can see the player)
      damage - damage dealt to the player on contact
      health - number of hits this enemy can take before dying

  • Method Details

    • takeHit

      public void takeHit(int damage, float sourceX, float sourceY)
      Called when the player's weapon hits this enemy. Reduces health, applies knockback, plays sound, and starts death animation if health reaches zero.
      Parameters:
      damage - the amount of health to subtract
      sourceX - the x position of the attack source (for knockback direction)
      sourceY - the y position of the attack source (for knockback direction)

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()
      Checks if this enemy is completely dead and ready to be removed.
      Returns:
      true if the death animation has finished

    • isDying

      public boolean isDying()
      Checks if this enemy is currently playing its death animation.
      Returns:
      true if dying but not yet fully dead

    • update

      public void update(float delta, Player player, MapManager mapManager)
      Updates the enemy's AI, movement, and combat logic every frame. Handles death animation, knockback, state switching (patrol vs attack), pathfinding, and collision with the player.
      Specified by:
      update in class Obstacle
      Parameters:
      delta - time passed since last frame in seconds
      player - reference to the player for targeting and collision
      mapManager - reference to the map for pathfinding and wall collision

    • addExtraHealth

      public void addExtraHealth(int bonus)
      Adds bonus health to this enemy for scaling difficulty in endless mode.
      Parameters:
      bonus - the amount of extra health to add

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch)
      Draws the enemy on screen with a red tint if recently hit.
      Overrides:
      draw in class GameObject
      Parameters:
      batch - the LibGDX batch used for rendering
